text: Guo (died 300), was a Chinese businesswoman and influential imperial favorite.Lily Xiao Hong Lee, Clara Lau, A.D. Stefanowska: Biographical Dictionary of Chinese Women: Antiquity Through Sui, 1600 B.C.E She was married to Wang Yan (d. 311) and the cousin of empress Jia Nanfeng, de facto regent of China. She was a favorite of her cousin the empress and became famous as a businesswoman when she used her position to accumulate a fortune through the beneficial contacts she acquired through her relationship with the empress. ==References== Category:3rd-century births Category:300 deaths Category:3rd-century Chinese women Category:Ancient businesswomen Category:Ancient businesspeople Category:Royal favourites
title: Guo (d. 300)
